anyone monitoring 146.76 tonight? yeah i’m heading home and figured i’d try the new antenna i mounted earlier. it’s honestly performing way better than the old magmount, barely any engine noise now. you’re coming in full quieting on my end too, super clean audio. guess propagation is helping us out tonight. anyway appreciate the report, i’ll be listening while i drive.

anyone want to try a simplex test on 52? i’ve got the roll-up j-pole taped to the apartment window and i’m curious how far it reaches. you’re making it across town surprisingly well actually, even with just five watts. i use ferrites everywhere now and it helped a ton with rf feedback. wanna try dropping power? go ahead, i’ll keep listening.

this is n7jtm testing new coax after ripping out old waterlogged rg-58. my noise floor dropped almost instantly when i swapped to lmr-240, way quieter than before. your signal is coming through louder and sharper too, no more weird swr jumps. i re-did all the connectors with proper crimps and it made a huge difference. thanks for the signal report, this really helped.

evening net control here doing early check-ins if anyone’s around. i’m cleaning the shack tonight and figured i’d hop on early since the repeater’s quiet. been working on a homemade 3-element yagi for 2m and it’s almost finished. the balun is just a coaxial choke but it seems to work fine in testing. anyway thanks for checking in early, standby for the net.

anyone hanging out on the machine tonight? i’m just soldering powerpoles again and needed background noise. honestly these connectors are lifesavers but only if you crimp them right, otherwise they wiggle loose after a few months. i finally bought the proper tool and it changed everything. your signal is booming in too, no flutter at all. propagation’s been ridiculously good this week.

quick question for anyone listening: does the repeater seem louder tonight? i swear the sysop bumped up the gain or retuned the audio path, because everything sounds warmer. they mentioned linking the system soon so maybe they’re testing levels. your mic upgrade really shows too, way cleaner highs compared to last week. honestly sounds like a commercial rig.

doing a portable check from a hiking trail, anyone copy me? i’m stuck behind a ridge so i expected flutter but this is actually readable. only five watts on a rubber duck and still making it to the machine. weather’s gorgeous out here so i figured i’d bring the ht. appreciate the report, i’ll be walking toward higher ground soon.

who is absolutely spamming aprs tonight? my igate is lighting up nonstop. turns out someone’s testing a digipeater and beaconing every 30 seconds which explains the chaos. honestly though it’s better than the usual dead air. i love when people experiment on aprs, keeps the network alive. glad to know my system isn’t glitching.

working on my homebrew j-pole today and finally got the swr down to about 1.3. it’s literally copper plumbing pipe but somehow it performs like a champ. hits the repeater full quieting even though it’s only ten feet off the ground. pretty wild what you can do with $12 of hardware store parts. can’t wait to try it on simplex later.

doing an emergency power test if anyone’s around. i just switched over to battery mode and the audio didn’t change at all which is a relief. was worried the inverter might inject some nasty hum but it’s clean. i’m prepping the go-kit for an emcomm drill this weekend so i wanted to test everything early. thanks for the quick check, super helpful.

finally finished programming that stubborn ht after chirp fought me all night. the cable wouldn’t seat correctly so i had to literally tape it down before it worked. once it connected though everything loaded smoothly. these radios are tanks but man their programming ports are finicky. glad it’s handled now.

any simplex traffic out there tonight? things are dead quiet on my end but i’m curious what range i can get. if you wanna try a quick check i can switch over to 52 in a second. i’m running a rooftop antenna so should be good. simplex nights like this are always fun. let me know if you’re game.

Break break for that station calling CQ, this is November Six Alpha Bravo Charlie with you, go ahead sir.
Kilo Foxtrot Zero Romeo Tango Yankee, monitoring the frequency, not much to report, just another day in paradise, over.
CQ DX CQ DX from the Sunshine State, Florida Alpha Five Xray Xray calling CQ on this fine morning, how copy?
Whiskey Eight November, I've got a quick one, just need a signal report then I'm gone, you copy me? Over.
Ah, good evening to you all. Victor Echo Three here, hoping for some pleasant conversation as the sun sets. Anyone care to join?
Emergency, emergency, emergency. This is a drill. Station Kilo Lima Seven conducting emergency traffic drill. This is drill. How copy? Over.
Mobile Hotel Seven, just cruising down the highway, looking for a quick contact to pass the time, anyone out there?
CQ Contest, CQ Contest, this is November Two Alpha, ready for your exchange, let's make it quick, 5-9 Nebraska.
Y'all copy me? This is Delta Xray Four stuck in a traffic jam. Might as well make a contact. Anyone on this here repeater?
Listen up, frequency in use, frequency in use. This is Net Control for the Tuesday traffic net. Check-ins commence now.
Testing, one two three. This is Juliet Alpha One testing a new microphone. Audio report please. Over.
CQ from the great white north, this is Victor Oscar Two, freezing my antenna off but still on the air, eh?
This is Kilo Eight Whiskey, I've got a beam pointed your way Europe, let's see if we can make this happen, CQ DX.
QRL? QRL? Is this frequency busy? Kilo Nine Mike Mike asking before I proceed. Over.
Roger that, solid copy, thank you for the report. This is Whiskey Three confirming QSL. 73 and clear.
Man, the bands are deader than a doornail tonight. This is November Five Romeo just about to throw in the towel. Last call?
Hey there, young operator here, this is Kilo Echo Zero, just got my ticket, super excited to make my first HF contact!
CQ from the shack. I've got the coffee hot and the rig warmed up. This is Alpha Alpha Seven, who wants to chat?
This is a directed call to Hotel Lima Three. Hotel Lima Three, this is Sierra Xray Two, do you copy? Over.
Proceed with your traffic. I am ready to copy. This is Zulu Lima Two standing by for your message. Go ahead.
Yeehaw! Got me a solid contact with Italy! This is November Four Bravo, thanks for the QSO Paolo, 73!
Please keep the frequency clear for emergency communications. We have severe weather in the area. This is public service announcement.
Uh, copy that, you're breaking up a bit. Could you repeat your call sign? This is Mike Oscar Six, over.
I've been listening to you guys for an hour. Finally got the nerve to key up. This is... uh... Whiskey Two, hello.
Let's QSY to 14.205, this QRM is unbearable. Kilo Two moving now. Meet you there.
This is Charlie Xray One with a formal CQ call. Seeking any station for a contact. Please respond. Over.
G'day mate! This is Victor Kilo Six, feels like I'm talking to myself. Anyone awake in this time zone?
Solid copy, old friend. Sounds like you're right next door. This is Alpha Bravo Five, what's new?
I have a very weak signal, perhaps a whisper. If you can hear Kilo Foxtrot Seven, please give a call.
This is the nightly roundtable. Topic is antenna designs. Check in if you'd like to contribute. Net Control is Oscarscar One.
CQ from a portable operation atop Black Mountain. The view is spectacular, the signals are not. Hotel Five Portable.
QRZ? QRZ? This is Sierraierra Two. Who called me? Please call again.
This is Papa Alpha Four, I am closing my station now. Thanks to all for the contacts. Clear and 73.
Attention all stations, attention all stations. A sudden ionospheric disturbance is reported. Expect degraded conditions. W1AW bulletin.
I'm just ragchewing with my buddy here, but we'll make room. This is Delta Echo Three, you're welcome to join us.
This is November Eight, I've got a question for the group: what's the best tuner for a random wire? Over.
BEEP BOOP BEEP. Just kidding, it's a human. This is Kilo Romeo Two playing with the voice keyer. CQ CQ.
Fair signal, considerable static. This is Quebec Eight, can barely make you out. Please repeat your name.
My XYL is yelling that dinner's ready. Gotta go! This is Whiskey Seven, 73 to all!
Copy that five by nine. Same here. Nice and easy contact. This is Limaima Two, thanks and 73.
This frequency appears to be in use by a net. Let's find a clear one. Oscarscar Two monitoring.
CQ from the desert. Dry air, great for antennas, bad for my skin. This is November Six Whiskey, listening.
I think we've got a lid on frequency playing music. Time to move along. This is Hotel Hotel Seven, clear.
Final call for the net. This is Net Control. Last check-ins, please. We are about to begin traffic.

By the book, now: CQ CQ CQ, this is November Three Alpha Bravo Charlie Delta, calling CQ and standing by for any station.
Ya hear that? Sounds like a pileup on 14.195. I'm gonna sneak in the back door. Whiskey One Oscar, calling that DX station, please?
Emergency net, emergency net, this is net control Sierraierra One. Stations with emergency traffic only. All others stand by.
This is a test of the Automatic Packet Reporting System. Station Kilo Four APRS igate monitoring. No voice response expected.
Mobile Kilo Eight, just passed a big rig with a nice antenna. Driver, that you? Come back.
*sigh* Another day, another kilowatt. Just kidding, running legal limit. Alpha One Romeo, calling CQ DX.
I swear I just heard a spark gap transmitter. Am I time traveling? This is Whiskey Zero Old, monitoring.
Copy all that, good buddy, you're coming in five-square on the S-meter. This is the Rubber Duck, clear and monitoring the channel.
CQ from a very, very quiet location. No power lines for miles. This is Quebec Romeo Two in the national forest.
Okay, listen, my neighbor's LED lights are wiping out 40 meters. I'm declaring war. This is November Seven Noise, seeking sympathy.
This is Papa Papa Zero with a formal traffic message. I have one routine message for station Alpha Alpha Six. Are you on frequency?
Can anyone else not stand the sound of that digital carrier? Sounds like a modem from hell. Kilo Hotel Two, agreeing loudly.
*Static crackle*...you're...breaking up...I think...the aurora... *more static* This...Victor Echo Six...maybe we'll try later...
I've got a morse code key here but I'm too lazy. Voice is easier. This is Lima Lima One, calling CQ.
Attention in the net, check-in with your call sign and emergency power status only. This is a solar storm drill. Oscarscar Three, net control.
Just a kid here with a hand-me-down radio. This is Foxtrotiver Four, is this thing on? Hello?
I am reading you with difficulty due to heavy QRMM from a nearby switching power supply. This is Delta Echo Four, please speak clearly.
Roger, wilco, affirmative. This is Kilo Nine copying all instructions. Proceeding to the next checkpoint. Over.
Man, you sound like you're in a barrel. Got a lot of reverb. This is MikeIke Two, might want to check your audio processing.
CQ from the top of the world! Well, my apartment building. But it's high! This is Hotel Four High, any takers?
Are we allowed to talk about...politics on here? Just kidding! Don't answer that! This is Whiskey Two Joker, clear.
I'm conducting a propagation beacon. Every ten minutes I will give my call. This is Beacon Station Bravo Three. First transmission.
Got a note from the FCC today. Just a renewal notice, scared me half to death! This is November Six Gulch, back on the air.
You are interfering with a scheduled moonbounce operation. Please QSY immediately. This is Echo Mike Echo One, serious.
Hello...hello? Testing. Is anyone listening on 146.550? This is...uh... Golfolf Six, new to this simplex thing.
This frequency is now occupied for a traffic handling practice session. General QSOs must QSY. This is Training Control, out.
I'm not saying I'm a pirate, but I'm broadcasting from international waters. Just kidding, it's Kilo Seven Boat.
Copy that you are 59 plus 20 dB. Fantastic signal. Must be that new antenna of yours. This is Oscarscar Seven, jealous.
All quiet on the Western Front. Too quiet. This is November Four Eerie, just listening to the white noise.
Prosign: SK. That's it for me. This is Charlie Charlie Two, going quiet. Final 73 to all my friends.
Can you give me a count? One, two, three, four, five. I need to set my mic gain. This is Alphaudio One, thanks.
I've got a major case of the dits. Must be a key stuck somewhere. This is Mike Oscar Seven, investigating.
CQ for a brand new country! Just activated zone 87. This is Special Event Station Eight Seven Xray, calling CQ!
Roger your last, switching to receive. Standing by for your traffic. This is Zulu Zulu One, ready to copy.
*In a dramatic whisper* The waterfall...it's full of eyes...digital eyes... This is Hotel Hotel P, signing off before I lose my mind.
Pse QSL via LoTW. I confirm our QSO. Thank you. This is Quebec Sierra Lima, clear and QRT.
This is not a drill. I repeat, this is not a drill. I have actual emergency traffic. All other stations cease transmission. Kilo Nine Actual, over.

This is your friendly neighborhood radio inspector. Kidding! But your signal is clean as a whistle. This is Lima Foxtrot One, 73.
QRP to QRP, let's make this happen. Five watts each, a prayer, and a good wire. This is Xray Ray Five calling CQ QRP.
Over over over, why does everyone say over? This is November Tango Two, just saying what I need to say. Clear.
CQ from a future QTH. I'm moving next week, but the tower stays. This is Victor Echo Five, a bit sad today.
Man, the sunspot number is up! Can you feel it? The bands are singing! This is Sierraierra Three, pumped!
This is a directed call to the station with the beautiful AM signal on 3885. Who are you? Kilo Alpha Three listening.
BEEP. Voice message follows. *Clears throat* This is Mikeike One with a message for Papa Papa Three. Call me on the landline. BEEP.
Copy that you are 5 by 9 plus. My beam is stuck pointing north, so you must be lucky. This is Whiskey Four North.
I have a phone patch set up for anyone needing to call home. Military and maritime priority. This is Zulu Alpha Service.
The static crashes sound like popcorn. Makes me hungry. This is Papa Oscar Pop, monitoring while I snack.
*Sounds of rain on a tin roof* That's my shack. Leaky roof, solid radio. This is India India Two, cozy in the storm.
You are very weak. Please turn up your power if possible. This is Golfolf Two, barely reading you.
CQ for a specific purpose: I need a good joke. My day is dull. This is Hotel Hotel Aha, tell me a funny one.
Proceed with your traffic. I am copying in triplicate. This is November Seven Scribe, ready for your words.
Mobile unit responding to the accident on Highway 10. Amateur radio support is on scene. Kilo Eight Responder, out.
Ten minutes of dead air, then a CQ. That's my style. Contemplative radio. This is Oscarscar Zen, calling CQ.
I think my cat just keyed the mic. *Meow* ...Yep. This is Foxtroteline Home, apologies for the feline interruption.
All stations, please be advised of a rogue carrier on 7.125. Avoid that frequency. This is Whiskey One Sentinel.
You sound like you're on the moon. Great signal but so... empty. This is Lima Echo Echo, curious about your setup.
CQ for a lonely operator in a big city. All I see are windows, but the radio sees the world. This is Kilo Four Towers.
Message begins: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog. Message ends. Just a test. Delta Echo Test, clear.
Copy all, good buddy, we are 10-10 on the side. Keep the shiny side up. This is the Green Light, over and out.
I am only listening. I will not speak today. My ears are open. This is Silent Key Whiskey, monitoring.
The net is now secured. Thank you for your disciplined traffic handling. Net Control Sierraierra Four, clear.
I've got a ghost signal. Fades in and out with no pattern. Spooky. This is Hotel Oscar Spirit, logging it.
Please speak phonetically. I am having trouble with your call sign. This is Alpha Bravo See, go ahead.
CQ from the land of ice and snow. Furnace is roaring, radio is warm. This is Victor Oscar Seven, wishing for summer.
You are broadcasting a carrier. Please check your PTT. This is Novemberiner Four, you've been on for 30 seconds.
My final contact. The cancer is back. Thank you all for the years of friendship. This is... this is Mikeyke Two. 73 and God bless.
CQ for a technical discussion. I'm building a linear amp from scratch. Thoughts on the input circuit? This is Tango Alpha Two.
The band just died. One second you're there, then gone. Wow. This is Whiskey Xray Void, talking to myself now.
All right, kids, time for your radio lesson. This is Grandpa Kilo, and today we're talking about SWR.
Emergency traffic has cleared. Frequency is now open for general use. This is Net Control, standing down.
I can hear my own voice coming back at me from somewhere. Weird echo. This is Echoo Echo, is that me?
CQ with a question: What's the best coffee for late-night DXing? This is Brewmaster Alpha, needing recommendations.
*Sound of a Morse key in the background* Sorry, my son is learning code. This is Papa Papa Dad, calling CQ anyway.
The only signal I hear is a steady hum. Probably my own power supply. This is Mikeike Hum, going to troubleshoot.
This contact is for the logbook only. Signal report and 73. Thank you. Quebec Logbook One, clear.
I am declaring this frequency a no-drone zone. Too much buzzing. This is Kilo Zulu Apiary, annoyed.
The sky is falling! I mean, the propagation is. Solar flare in progress. This is Alpha Lima Armageddon, maybe overreacting.
Good signal, old man. Sounds like you're using that old Collins gear. Nothing beats it. This is Sierra Sierra Vintage.
Message from the council: The club antenna party is Saturday. Bring tools. This is the Town Crier, out.
Copy that you are five by nine. My beam is pointed at a brick wall, so that's impressive. This is Wallflower November.
This is not a voice. This is a text-to-speech generator for a silent operator. K Two T T S, calling CQ.
I have a visual on the rocket launch! Describing it over the air. Wow, the plume! This is Cape Charlie One.
And... we're back. Power outage took me down. This is Generator Kilo, back on the air and louder than ever.
CQ for a philosopher. If a tree falls in a forest and no one is on 40 meters to hear it, does it make a noise? Over.

Boldly calling CQ where no man has called CQ before... actually, probably everyone has. This is Starship Kilo, seeking new life.
*Sound of a deep breath* Okay. First HF contact. Nervous. This is November November One. CQ?
Signal fading like my hairline. Up and down, up and down. This is Foxtrotader Seven, holding on for dear life.
All stations, this is a beacon. My call, a grid square, and a wish for good propagation. Whiskey Seven Beacon... FN42... 73.
CQ for the night owls, the insomniacs, the dreamers. This is the Witching Hour Net, unofficially. Oscarscar Night, listening.
You're coming in like you're sitting in my shack. Absolutely pinning the S-meter. What's your secret? This is Envy Kilo.
Mobile Alpha Mike, just got cut off by a semi. Trucker, if you're listening, you owe me a new antenna!
This frequency is a sanctuary. No politics, no religion, just radios. Welcome. This is Sanctuary Sierra.
Copy your last, but it was garbled. Sounded like you said 'send pickles'. Over? This is Confused Charlie.
I am broadcasting from my fallout shelter. Not really, but it's a sturdy basement. This is Bunker Bravo, secure.
The hiss... the constant hiss of the universe. It's beautiful. This is Listener Lima, at peace with the noise.
CQ with a mission: I need to contact someone in IT to fix my printer. Ham radio help desk, open. This is Delta Delta Help.
*In a terrible British accent* I say, old chap, frightful QRM on the band, what? Jolly bad show. This is G8 Imposter, pip pip.
Storm spotter network is active. Reporting hail, dime-sized, at my location. Kilo Eight Spotter, out.
Your audio is overdriven. Sounds like you're yelling into a tin can. This is Audio Alpha, friendly advice.
This is a recording of a CQ call played backwards. *Garbled electronic speech* Just seeing if you're paying attention. K2TST.
I have made contact with the promised land! A station in Tuvalu! Logged! This is Hunter Hotel, victorious!
My XYL says if I buy one more radio part, I'm living in the shack. Worth it. This is Shackdweller Kilo.
Prosign: AA. All after. I have more to say following the break. This is November Break One, stand by.
The digital modes are a wall of color on my screen. I miss voices. This is Analog Alpha, calling CQ.
CQ from a man with too many antennas and not enough time. This is Tower Tango, climbing later.
Read you lima charlie, good buddy. We are copyin' you five square. Keep them wheels turnin'. This is the Roadrunner, over.
Attention. My dog has learned to bark in Morse code. .-- --- ..- ..-. (WOOF). This is Proud Papa Oscar.
Solar flux is 75. A-index is 15. K-index is 4. Prognosis: poor. This is Doctor Prop, signing off.
Just plugged in a vacuum cleaner and my radio died. Coincidence? I think not. This is Grumpy Kilo.
This is a test of the emergency alert system. Had to say it. This is Not The Government, really.
CQ for a specific grid: EM28. I need you for my VUCC. Any station in EM28? This is Grid Hunter Foxtrot.
I've been listening to you ragchew for an hour. Sounds like a good conversation. Mind if I join? Whiskey Two Joiner.
My final transmission. Selling the gear. Moving to a condo with no antennas. It's been a pleasure. Oscarscar Final, 73.
The repeater is... *beep* ...sorry, dropped the mic. This is Clumsy Charlie, back.
I am receiving a strange, pulsed signal. Almost rhythmic. Anyone else hearing this? This is Puzzled Papa.
All right, you primitive screwheads, listen up! This is my boomstick! I mean, my boom microphone. Shop Smart. This is Army of Darkness reference, K4ASH.
CQ with a confession: I have no idea what I'm doing, but I'm having fun. This is Novice November, learning.
You are the first voice I've heard in three days. Thank you. This is Isolated India, grateful.
This frequency is now the official broadcast of 'Two Guys Arguing About Antennas.' Audience participation welcome. This is Moderator Mike.
The pileup is a beast. A roaring, chaotic beast. I love it. This is Hunter Hotel Two, in the fray!
Message from the future: Propagation gets better in 2026. Or maybe worse. This is Time Traveler Tango.
My cat is walking on the keyboard. Sending random FT8 messages. Sorry, world. This is Cat5 Kilo.
CQ for a poet. The ionosphere is a mirror, cracked, reflecting our whispers back to the void. This is Romantic Romeo.
Solid copy. No need to repeat. Efficient and clear. This is Business Bravo, 73.
The only thing coming through is a faint carrier and my disappointment. This is Sighing Sierra, monitoring.
I am now controlling the net. There is no net. I am net control of nothing. This is Surreal Sierra, over.
CQ from the edge of the map. Here there be dragons. And poor propagation. This is Explorer Xray.
*Singing* CQ, CQ, is anybody out there? Just a lonely radio guy... This is Balladeer Bravo, sorry for the singing.
Your signal is so clean, it's like you're in the next room. What filter width are you using? This is Curious Quebec.
This is the sound of one hand clapping. The sound of an unmodulated carrier. Please stop. Kilo Nine Quiet, requesting.
And that, my friends, concludes our broadcast day. The national anthem will play now. *Static* Just kidding. W1JKE clear.

This is the Century Station, we have been on the air for one hundred years. Just kidding, but it feels like it. Whiskey One Hundred, monitoring.
Copy that you're in the log. Thanks for the contact. Short and sweet. This is November Logbook, clear.
The hum is back. That sixty-cycle hum from the power lines. Drives me nuts. This is Hum Hunter Hotel.
CQ for anyone who remembers tube radios. The smell of ozone, the warm glow. This is Nostalgia November.
Mobile Yankee Zulu, just drove under a power line and my signal dropped out. Back now.
Net call. This is the Wednesday Night Check-in Net. Say your call and whether you have traffic. Net Control is Alpha One.
I think my antenna is a better bird perch than a radiator. Evidence on the ground. This is Droppings Delta.
Your signal is fluttery, like a flag in the wind. Must be auroral propagation. This is Flutter Foxtrot.
Roger, wilco, out. Did I say that right? New guy here. This is Procedure Papa, learning.
This is not a communication. This is art. The static is my canvas. *Key clicks* This is Artist Alpha.
Copy all, you're five by nine into Lisbon. Wait, you're in Ohio? Amazing skip today. This is Amazed Alpha.
I am sending a mental image of my shack. Did you get it? Over. This is Telepath Tango.
Storm spotter to net control: rotation sighted. Taking cover now. Kilo Two Spotter, out.
CQ with a heavy heart. A silent key in our community today. Remembering W5XYZ. This is Memorial Mike.
The repeater input is full of noise. Sounds like a diesel engine. Who's mobile and idling? This ase Echo.
I have achieved the perfect match. SWR is 1:1. I feel complete. This is Satisfied Sierra.
All this technology and I just want to talk to one person clearly. Is that too much to ask? This is Simple Sierra.
CQ from a man who just realized his fly was down during his last transmission. The secret is out. This is Embarrassed Echo.
Prosign: AA. Stand by for a long story about my childhood. You asked. This is Storyteller Sierra.
The band is so dead I can hear my own heartbeat through the headphones. This is Spooky Sierra.
Mobile unit clear of the emergency. Returning to service. Thanks for the relay. Kilo Nine Service.
I am only using vowels tonight. A E I O U. How copy? Over. This is Vowel Victor.
You sound like a robot. A very clear robot. Are you a robot? This is Suspicious Sierra.
CQ for a contact with someone named Dave. I have a message for Dave from his wife. Any Dave?
The solar wind is blowing hard. Expect fading. This is Space Weather Sierra, with your forecast.
I have a new noise-canceling microphone. Can you hear the difference? This ase Test.
Copy that, we are QSL. I confirm the contact. I will send a card. This is Old School Oscar.
My amplifier just went *pop*. And then there was smoke. Gotta go. This is Smoky Sierra, clear.
This frequency is a digital desert. No FT8, no PSK, just... us. I like it. This is Oasis Oscar.
I'm logging this as a maritime mobile. I'm on a pond in a rowboat. Does that count? This ase Loophole.
Net is secured. Great discipline. Next net at 2100Z. Net Control, clear.
I am receiving you via moonbounce. Your signal went to the moon and back. Say something profound. This is Moonbeam Mike.
My cat is now sleeping on the warm radio. Priority: cat comfort. This is Catlover Kilo.
Static crashes like thunder. Must be a big storm somewhere. This is Stormfront Sierra.
QRZ? This is Sierra Xray One. Who called CQ? I had you then lost you.
CQ with a question of philosophy: If a repeater repeats everything, does it have its own voice? Over.
You are broadcasting CW on your voice frequency. Sidetone is leaking. This is Leaky Lima.
I am listening through a web SDR in another country. You're loud in Switzerland! This is Virtual Victor.
Traffic for station Alpha Bravo Six. I have one routine message. Are you on frequency?
The ionosphere is a fickle friend. Here one minute, gone the next. This is Fickle Foxtrot.
My hands are cold. The shack is unheated. But the radio is warm. This is Dedicated Delta.
CQ for a specific color. I'm thinking of a color. Guess it. This is Game Golf.
All stations, be advised of a T-storm warning for the county. Take precautions. This is Weather Whiskey.
I think I just worked a station on a different continent using a paperclip antenna. I need to lie down.
This is the sound of me giving up for the night. *Long sigh into microphone* Kilo Four Frustrated, clear.
You have a beautiful signal. Clean, crisp audio. A pleasure to listen to. This ase Appreciator.
My neighbor just put up a new LED security light. I can hear it on every band. The war continues. This is Warrior Whiskey.
Emergency drill concluded. All units return to normal status. Drill Control, out.
I'm broadcasting from a Faraday cage. Can you hear me now? Testing. This is Cagey Charlie.
CQ from the future! Actually, just from the next time zone. But it feels like the future. This is Zulu Time Zulu.
Your call sign is a palindrome. That's cool. This is Noticing November.
I am sending a slow-scan TV picture of my lunch. Tuna sandwich. Do you copy? This ase TV.
The only thing in my log today is noise. I'm logging the noise. S9 on the meter. This is Logger Lima.
Copy that, you are 59. My beam is pointing the wrong way. You must be everywhere. This is Omnipresent Oscar.
Net traffic: The meeting is moved to Thursday. I say again, Thursday. This is Messenger Mike.
I have a problem with feedback. Hear that squeal? That's my problem. This is Squealing Sierra.
CQ for a doctor. I have a radio with a fever. It's running hot. Medical advice needed. This ase Doctor.
The aurora is so strong I can talk to the next state over on UHF. Wild. This is Aurora Alpha.
My final call was in Morse. I'm learning. Sorry for the slow speed. This is Student Sierra.
This is a beacon of hope in a noisy world. Just a voice saying hello. This is Hope Hotel.
You're breaking up. You're... *digital breakup sound* ...gone. This is Digital Dropout Delta.
I am now narrating my life. I am pressing the PTT. I am talking. I am releasing the PTT. This is Narrator November.
CQ for a station with a funny story. Make me laugh. I dare you. This is Chuckles Charlie.
The propagation forecast was wrong. Delightfully wrong. I'm working stations I shouldn't. This is Happy Hotel.
Storm spotter report: wall cloud to my west. Looks nasty. Kilo Seven Spotter, standing by.
I think my antenna is talking to me. It's whispering... 'SWR... SWR...' This is Crazy Kilo.
All business. Signal report only. 5-9. QSL? Thank you. This is No-Nonsense November.
This frequency is a refuge from the digital madness. A voice in the wilderness. Welcome.
My radio has more buttons than my car. I understand my car better. This is Confused Charlie.
CQ with a secret. The secret is: I don't know what I'm doing half the time. Don't tell anyone. This is Secret Sierra.
Copy your last transmission, but it was encrypted by my imagination. I decoded it as 'send cookies'. Over?
I am the net control for the net that doesn't exist. Check in if you don't exist. Over.
The quiet is louder than the noise. The space between transmissions is vast. This is Philosopher Foxtrot.
Mobile in a tunnel. Signal will drop... now. *silence* ...and I'm back! This is Tunnel Tango.
My XYL says the radio is my mistress. She's not wrong. This is Guilty Golf.
Beacon transmission: Call. Grid. Altitude. November Beacon. EM48. 1200 feet. Out.
You have a very calming voice. You should do radio professionally. This is Compliment Charlie.
Emergency traffic: I have a kitten stuck in a tree. Not really an emergency, but she's cute. Requesting advice.
The sun just set. The gray line is working its magic. Stations popping up. This is Magician Mike.
I am sending a thought. The thought is: 'This is silly.' Did you receive it? This is Silly Sierra.
All stations, cease transmission. I have priority traffic. This is Priority Papa.
My amplifier fan is the loudest thing in the shack. Sounds like a jet engine. Can you hear it?
CQ from a parallel universe. Here, everyone uses AM. It's wonderful. This is Alternate Alpha.
Log entry: Contact failed. Reason: lost nerve and didn't call. This is Shy Sierra, monitoring.
The digital waterfall looks like a rainbow puked. So many signals. This is Rainbow Romeo.
Prosign: SK for now. My coffee is done. This is Coffee Charlie, clear.
You are like a ghost. Fading in and out. A signal from the past. This is Ghostly Golf.
This is a test of the emergency communication system. This is only a test. BEEP.
I have conquered the pileup! The DX station came back to me! Victory is mine! This is Victorious Victor.
My antenna is a coat hanger. I am not kidding. It works... poorly. This is McGyver Mike.
Net check-ins are closed. We will now take traffic. Net Control is Oscar Traffic.
The sound of rain on the roof is interfering with my ability to hear you. Poetic interference. This ase Poet.
CQ for a specific person. You know who you are. Call me. This is Vague Victor.
Copy that, we are in the log. Short contact. Efficient. I like it. 73. This is Efficient Echo.
I am broadcasting a slow, steady tone. It is the tone of existential dread. Or maybe a stuck key. This is Dread Delta.
All this gear and the best contact I had today was on a handheld to the local repeater. Humbling.
This is the voice of your conscience. You should check your antenna connections. This is Conscience Charlie.
Storm update: hail has stopped, heavy rain continues. Kilo Two Weather, out.
I think I just worked a satellite with a handheld. My arm is tired from holding it up. This is Sore Sierra.
The QRM is intentional. Someone is jamming. How rude. This is Jammed Juliet.
CQ from the edge of the grid. One more contact and I get my award. Please be the one. This is Begging Bravo.
My radio is older than I am. It has tubes. I fear it. This is Timid Tango.
Message from the past: We used to have more sunspots. Sincerely, 1958. This is Old Timer Oscar.
You are cutting in and out like a bad connection. Are you twisting in the wind? This ase Inquisitor.
This frequency is now the official broadcast of 'Guy Eating Chips.' *crunch* Over.
I have achieved radio silence. I am not transmitting. This sentence is a paradox. This is Paradox Papa.
The pileup is a monster. I am throwing my call into its maw. Wish me luck. This is Brave Bravo.
Net is now open for comments on the new club bylaws. Keep it civil. Net Control, moderating.
My cat walked on the keyboard and sent a perfect CQ in Morse. She's getting her license next. This is Proud Papa.
Solar flare inbound. Expect communications blackout in 10...9...8... Kidding. But maybe. This is Joker Juliet.
CQ with a feeling. The feeling is loneliness. Is anyone out there? Really? This is Lonely Lima.
You sound like you're underwater. Gurgly audio. Check your connections. This ase Advisor.
This is not a QSO. This is a cry for help. My project is a mess. Send help. Or a schematic.
All clear from the storm spotter network. Severe weather has moved east. Net secured.
I am listening to the cosmic microwave background radiation. It's very... static. This is Cosmic Charlie.
Your signal is a diamond in the rough. A clear tone amidst the noise. This is Appreciative Alpha.
CQ for someone who understands impedance matching. I have a question about baluns. Over.
My final transmission from this location. Moving tomorrow. Keep the airwaves warm. This is Moving Mike, 73.
The repeater is voting. I can hear it switching sites. Sounds like a relay race. This is Listener Lima.
I am sending a picture with my mind. It's a sunset. Did you see it? Over.
Traffic handled. Message delivered. Satisfaction achieved. This is Router Romeo, clear.
Band is closing. Signals are sinking into the noise. Like ships going down. This is Dramatic Delta.
This is a beacon of futility in an uncaring universe. But hey, my SWR is good. This is Optimistic Oscar.
Copy all. Good signal. Nice to meet you. Short and sweet. 73. This is Sweet Sierra.
I have become one with the radio. We are a single entity. The hum is my mantra. This is Zen Zulu.
Emergency test message: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog. 1234567890. Test ends.
CQ from a station with nothing to say but a desire to say something. This is Verbose Victor.
You are like a rock. Solid, steady signal. Unmoving. I appreciate that. This is Steady Sierra.
My antenna is a noodle. A floppy noodle. It works, but it lacks dignity. This is Noodle November.
Net participants, remember to use plain language. No ten-codes. This is Net Control, reminding you.
The silence between your words is as important as the words. I enjoy the silence. This is Silent Sierra.
I just contacted myself via a long-path reflection. That's either brilliant or very sad. This is Reflective Romeo.
All stations, a moment of silence for our absent friends. *10 seconds of static* Thank you.
CQ with a riddle: What is full of holes but still holds water? A sponge! Gotcha. This is Riddler Romeo.
Your signal is a journey. It fades, it peaks, it tells a story of the ionosphere. This is Storyteller Sierra.
Mobile and lost. Using the repeater to get directions. Any locals on? This is Lost Lima.
This transmission is a work of fiction. Any resemblance to actual QSOs is purely coincidental. This is Fiction Foxtrot.
I am the walrus. Coo coo ca choo. Sorry, channeling Lennon. This is Beatle Bravo.
Propagation is like a box of chocolates. You never know what you're gonna get. This is Gump Golf.
Logging this as a cross-band contact. I'm on UHF, you're on HF. This is a loophole I enjoy. This is Loophole Lima.
The noise floor is rising. It's like the ocean coming in. Drowning the weak signals. This is Oceanic Oscar.
My ambition is to have a contact so clean, so perfect, it brings a tear to the eye. Not today. This is Hopeful Hotel.
